page.title: 09CULWORTH VILLAGE POSTMAN
page.content: At 5am{ Postman Bob}starts work at Banbury Sorting Office.At 6:30am he departs in his {red MORRIS MARINA van} for his rural round of 324 delivery points in Edgecote,Culworth,Sulgrave and Stuchbury,travelling by the same route each day.He is kind and friendly. He enjoys work except on rainy days.We watched him open the Culworth postbox- 80 letters that morning.Inside the Post Office he collects parcels,packets, foreign and special mail.Mr Wilding, the Sub Postmaster,signs his log book. Bob wears a grey uniform.His badge is number 759. His black hat has a badge with two post horns on it.Postmen train for two weeks ,are accompanied for two days,then are on their own.They earn about $70a week basic.Postman Bob also met us at Banbury Sorting Office to show us round.
